text: Marie Steichen (died September 2006) was a Democratic politician from Woonsocket, South Dakota, who gained fame for winning a local election two months after dying of cancer. In the general election of November 7, 2006 she defeated, by a vote of 100 to 64, the incumbent Republican candidate Merlin Feistner for the post of commissioner of Jerauld County in the U.S. state of South Dakota. This was the first time she had stood for election for political office. She and her husband Harold lived on a farm south of Lane, South Dakota. In the primary election, she had defeated Rick Easton of Wessington Springs by just one vote, 22–21.Plainsman Online ==See also== *Mel Carnahan ==References== Category:Year of birth missing Category:2006 deaths Category:Deaths from cancer in South Dakota Category:Women in South Dakota politics Category:People from Jerauld County, South Dakota Category:South Dakota Democrats Category:21st-century American politicians Category:21st- century American women politicians Category:People from Woonsocket, South Dakota
title: Marie Steichen
